ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to read short stories critically, how to edit and write short fiction
I learned how to more closely look at what I read for techniques to use in my own writing; I was given the opportunity to freely write what I wanted and not for a specific audience.

I became a better reader. I honed my critical and creative thinking skills while closely examining classic works of short fiction. I became a better writer. Prof Choi gives wonderfully detailed, personalized feedback that I was able to implement over the course of the semester.
I learned so much about different types of fiction writing and different styles, and I think gained a lot of tools I can use in the future.

Through the many exercises we wrote in the course, I felt that I became more acquainted with the practice of creative writing. I felt more confident in my ability to generate new material and revise it. I also was able to garner insight into the art of writing short stories by reading many excellent works that Prof. Choi selected.
My writing skills grew tremendously.
I learned about how to write fiction. I think it made me a more creative writer.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not a lot of feedback from peers, but readings/assignments super interesting. Could be more in-class writing

strengths-
weekly writing assignments; customized feedback; small class size; seminar style class structure

Weaknesses-
i really liked when we did in class workshops on pieces and wouldve liked to see that more and less weekly readings. I found the weekly reading discussions valuable only when we talked about the techniques or style that a writer used, but oftentimes, we weren't necessarily discussing those things.
No weaknesses! Prof Choi is wonderful. Perfect amount of reading, discussion, workshopping, in-class writing. Wonderfully balanced and enriching.

The strengths were definitely the instructor. Susan Choi is absolutely amazing. The weakness would probably be that I think we could have done more whole class workshops. I think that would be particularly educational to hear what other people have to say about certain pieces of work that a student wrote.

Strengths: Reading assignments, writing exercises, Prof. Choi and her feedback
Weaknesses: I wish there were more assignments or we met more regularly.
I loved this course! It was fun, engaging, and also a great learning experience.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's so good

This course is amazing for someone who is interested in writing but not quite sure about how form or technique fits into your writing; this class has weekly assignments that are manageable and conducive to practicing different strategies and trying out new writing styles, which is perfect for a budding writer coming into his or her style.
Yes! It's a great and low-stakes way to have some structure for trying out, or continuing to write, fiction.
100%! Especially with Prof Choi. Really special to have this kind of detailed, personalized feedback.
Yes, absolutely. This class was so engaging, but also wasn't stressful which was perfect. I feel like I learned so much without being stressed.
Yes! Susan Choi is an amazing instructor and our readings for class are really varied and compelling.

Yes! Prof. Choi is a great teacher to guide students through the beginning hurdles to writing fiction, and she also does a great job of encouraging students to write more material that they thought previously possible.
This class was amazing. Susan Choi was a wonderful professor, and the writing assignments really helped strengthen my writing skills.
Yes! I think anyone would benefit from taking a fiction class. It makes you think differently about all your writing and it was also a really fun experience.
